data="""Information about darcplot:
If you right-click on a plot, a (detatchable) toolbar appears. Since this is a plot window, you can try it now. This allows you to do several important things: 1. Subscribe to different telemetry streams at different decimation rates. 2. Select different plot configuration files (next to the activate button). 3. Develop your own plot configuration (in the text box area in the bottom right hand corner). 4. Load and save data or plot configurations. 5. Add overlays to your plot (only for 2D data in fast mode). 6. Spawn a new instance of darcplot. 7. Information about current frame numbers and timestamps.
If you have a directory with your own plot configurations in, you can start darcplot with -c /path/to/your/plots/ You can also start darcplot by giving the name of a plot configuration file on the command line. Or you can start it with a telemtry stream name and optional decimation. When doing this, you can also provide some text to go into the text box area, so that you can do simple things with your data.
Some examples: darcplot plotMine.xml darcplot rtcPxlBuf 100 darcplot rtcPxlBuf 10 -m "data.shape=128,128;fast=1"
Plenty of other things are possible too.
The default plots give a few ways of viewing data for a fairly straightforward system. If you have a more complicated system you will need to create your own plot configuration files, for example if camera pixels are interleaved in your data stream. """ tbNames=[] title="Information"
